docs.title: maPlan Project
docs.text: A metadata service in collaboration between NFDI4DataScience and DMP4NFDI

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The creation of AI models involve research artifacts such as datasets and software, to finally obtain the AI model itself. These three artifcats should be managed along the research cycle in an integrated and harmonized way.

To achieve this, we propose a machine-actionable AI Research Plan (maPlan), which combines elements from Data Management Plans (DMPs) and Datasheets, Softaware Management Plans (SMPs), and Model Cards, together with metadata layers enabling machine-actionability.

docs.title: Current status
docs.text: At the moment, in collaboration with NFDI4DataScience and DMP4NFDI, we are focusing on DMPs and SMPs plus the metadata layer required by them.

docs.title: Activities at DMP4NFDI
docs.text: A maDMP is being under development by DMP4NFDI and our maSMP will be later integrated to it. In this way, researchers will have the chance to have in one place a management plan for their data together with the software used to collect it and transform it.

docs.title: Activities at NFDI4NFD
docs.text:
A management plan for AI models does not exist yet. The closer to it would be the Machine Learning model cards. Despite being intially defined for Machine Learning, they work well for Deep Learning and Generative AI (e.g., Large Language Models). We have started with awaraness and outreach on the subject, as they are not yet well adopted.

In addition to ML Model Cards, Datasheet Cards are also used in AI approaches, to document the data used for training and/or evaluation. Once we have the first integrated DMP+SMP template in DMP4NFDI, we will proceed to extend it so it also includes elements from Datasheet Cards.

docs.title: Related projects in NFDI4DS
docs.text:
In-silico protocols for AI reproducibility in another project part of NFDI4DS. While maPlan focuses on basic aspected relevant to DMP+SMP activities, in-silico protocols aim at representing the whole AI workflow, from pre-processing to deployment, with rich metadata, so it can be used as a first layer to improve and assess reproducibility. In-silico protocols scope regarding metadata and tools is more comprenhensive that the one from maPlan. maPlan metadata schemas wil reused in in-silico protocols as needed.

DMPS You can find more information on DMPs at DMP4NFDI and the Research Data Management Organiser (RDMO)

SMPs You can find more information on SMPs at maSMPs

docs.title: AI Model Cards
docs.text:
AI Model Cards

An ML Model Card is a structured document that accompanies a trained ML model. Despite being named as ML Model Card, they can also be used for Deep Learning and Generative AI models.

A Model Card is key to share and reuse a model, providing essential human-readable context that makes a model trustworthy and truly reusable. They were first proposed by Google, see Model cards. They include information about the model, its intended use, training data, performance metrics, and ethical considerations. Although they are not yet well-adopted, some platforms such as Hugging Face facilitate their use by offering a template.

In the long run, we believe that information from the Model Cards should also be part of Resaerch Mangement Plans for projects including the creation of AI models.

These are our tutorials on the topic:

  • Tutorial: Introduction to ML model cards
  • Tutorial: Introduction to FAIR4ML, a vocabulary to describe FAIR AI models
  • Tutorial: Introduction to MLentory, a metadata registry for AI models

We have also contributed to the creation on a schema.org extension to represent AI Model Cards, in collaboration with the Research Data Alliance FAIR4ML Interest Group and the Ontology Engineering Group form the Polytechnic University of Madrid:

  • Lifecycle for FAIR Machine Learning
  • Towards metadata for machine learning - Crosswalk tables
  • FAIR4ML schema
  • FAIR4ML schema website

docs.title: Data management plans
docs.text:
Data Management Plans

DMPs are probably better know than Software Management Plans as they are nowadays commonly requested by funders. A DMP helps researchers to focus on some steps needed to properly handle research data, from collection to publication and archiving.

A metadata layer can be added to DMPs behind the scenes, so they become more interoperable and resusable, even across multiple DMP platforms. The Research Data Alliance DMP Commons Working Group started an effort on machine-actionable DMPs (maDMPs) around 2018, with the first version released towards the end of 2019. DMP4NFDI has already started mapping their DMP template to this RDA effort.

We have contribute to the machine-actionability of DMPs with the organization of a hackathon from 28 to 30 October 2024, the outcomes are listed here:

  • Crosswalks from the NFDI4DS hackathon "machine-actionable Data Management Plan for NFDI"
  • Identification of core elements for a machine-actionable Data Management Plan metadata schema in the NFDI

You can find more information on DMPs at DMP4NFDI and the Research Data Management Organiser (RDMO)

docs.title: Software management plans
docs.text:
Software Management Plans

SMPs are similar to Data Management Plans but focusing on software rather than datasets. Ideally, they should not be defined on their own but together with a DMP, as they will share some common information related to the research project covering them both. SMPs are still new and not yet well-adopted.

To raise awareness about SMPs, and make it easier for researchers to adopt them, we have offered some training and outreach. SMPs rely on good practices for research software development, aligned to the Findable, Accessible, Interoperable and Reusable for Research Software (FAIR4RS) principles. We have focused then on those good practices that researchers can follow without adding much burden to their already busy schedule.

Some of our presentations and tutorials are listed here:

  • Introduction and tutorial on Metadata and SMPs for FAIR research software
  • An introduction to machine-actionable Software Management Plans - Practical steps towards FAIR4RS
  • Machine-Actionable Metadata for Software and Software Management Plans for NFDI - Presentation
  • machine-actionable Software Management Plans

Additional related material:

  • An Introduction to Schema.org and JSON-LD

We also created a schema.org-based metadata schema maSMPs as part of the activities at NFDI4DS. Further development of our maSMP metadata schema will continue now as part of DMP4NFDI.

More information about SMPs available at maSMPs, including links to the metadata schema, profiles, and publications.
